snippet: A $1 billion city without residents will be developed in Lea County near Hobbs to help researchers test everything from intelligent traffic systems to automated washing machines and self-flushing toilets.
abstract: Researchers are developing a $1billion city without residents in Lea County, NM, near Hobbs to help test everything from intelligent traffic systems to automated washing machines and self-flushing toilets; research facility is seen as central to diversifying the area's economy.
lead_paragraph: A $1 billion city without residents will be developed in Lea County near Hobbs to help researchers test everything from intelligent traffic systems to automated washing machines and self-flushing toilets.

headline.main: New Mexico: Lea County Is Chosen for $1 Billion Ghost Town for Research
